qas.question: What manager updated the players uniforms in 1933?
What brighter shade of red did Chapman adopt?
What distinctive change did Chapman make to the Arsenal shirts?
For what style of shirts Arsenal known ?
What did Arsenal want to commemorate by wearing dark red shirts in their last season at Highbury?
What color was Arsenal's sleeves before 1933?
In what stadium did Arsenal play after the 2005-06 season?
In what year did Herbert Chapman become manager of Arsenal?
In what year was Arsenal founded?

context: In <b7_0><b8_0>1933<b8_0/><b7_0/>, <a0_0><b9_0>Herbert Chapman<b9_0/><a0_0/>, wanting his players to be more distinctly dressed, updated the kit, adding <b5_0>white<b5_0/> sleeves and changing the shade to a brighter <a1_0>pillar box red<a1_0/>. Two possibilities have been suggested for the origin of the <a2_0>white sleeves<a2_0/>. One story reports that Chapman noticed a supporter in the stands wearing a red sleeveless sweater over a white shirt; another was that he was inspired by a similar outfit worn by the cartoonist Tom Webster, with whom Chapman played golf. Regardless of which story is true, the <a3_0>red and white<a3_0/> shirts have come to define Arsenal and the team have worn the combination ever since, aside from two seasons. The first was 1966–67, when Arsenal wore all-red shirts; this proved unpopular and the white sleeves returned the following season. The second was 2005–06, the last season that Arsenal played at <b6_0>Highbury<b6_0/>, when the team wore commemorative redcurrant shirts similar to those worn in 1913, their <a4_0>first season<a4_0/> in the stadium; the club reverted to their normal colours at the start of the next season. In the 2008–09 season, Arsenal replaced the traditional all-white sleeves with red sleeves with a broad white stripe.
